modules.description: Implements parsing and generation of Emacs-specific S-expressions, including handling of symbols, lists, and nested structures. Provides functions to convert between OCaml values and S-expression representations used in Emacs communication. Used to serialize and deserialize data for interaction with Emacs through its native format.

Transforms and manipulates Emacs s-expressions using recursive mapping over atoms and cons-cells, with functions to build, check, and serialize lists. Works with polymorphic sexp types and basic s-expressions, supporting operations like list membership and conversion between strings and sexp structures. Enables parsing and serialization of s-expressions from channels, file descriptors, and raw strings.

Provides session management and communication through server endpoints, handling client connections and text-based interactions. Operates with session objects and shell interfaces to manage user input and output. Used to launch and control session servers for interactive applications.

Provides session-based command execution with custom greeting handling and text input processing. Operates on session objects and shell interfaces to manage user interactions. Enables structured command responses and dynamic text-based user input handling.

provides a framework for interacting with Emacsv0.4.1-1-ga87e613, focusing on low-level communication protocols. it defines message structures, serialization routines, and connection management utilities. users can establish sessions, send structured data, and handle protocol-specific events. examples include parsing incoming byte streams and generating control signals for external processes.

Provides functions to manage sessions and shells, create and manipulate buffers, and handle cursor and menu interactions. Works with custom types such as `shell`, `buffer`, and typed menus with items and submenus. Enables low-level buffer operations, cursor placement, and UI elements like popups and file name input within an Emacs-like environment.

Manages communication channels for exchanging enriched s-expressions, including remote function references, and handles cancellation of ongoing operations. It works with session states, error handling, and output functions to facilitate bidirectional data exchange. Used to establish and terminate connections, track pending remote operations, and manage session lifecycle events.
